title: Japan stocks higher at close of trade; Nikkei 225 up 0.13%
text:
© Reuters. Japan stocks higher at close of trade; Nikkei 225 up 0.13%

Investing.com – Japan stocks were higher after the close on Thursday, as gains in the , and sectors led shares higher.

At the close in Tokyo, the gained 0.13%.

The best performers of the session on the were Fukuoka Financial Group, Inc. (T: ), which rose 3.85% or 79.0 points to trade at 2133.0 at the close. Meanwhile, Kawasaki Kisen Kaisha, Ltd. (T: ) added 3.84% or 48.0 points to end at 1298.0 and JFE Holdings, Inc. (T: ) was up 3.79% or 49.5 points to 1356.5 in late trade.

The worst performers of the session were DeNA Co Ltd (T: ), which fell 5.45% or 109.0 points to trade at 1890.0 at the close. Daiichi Sankyo Co., Ltd. (T: ) declined 2.51% or 175.0 points to end at 6810.0 and The Kansai Electric Power Co. (T: ) was down 2.42% or 34.5 points to 1393.5.

Rising stocks outnumbered declining ones on the Tokyo Stock Exchange by 2195 to 1347 and 212 ended unchanged.

The , which measures the implied volatility of Nikkei 225 options, was unchanged 0.00% to 17.61.

Crude oil for November delivery was down 0.39% or 0.22 to $56.27 a barrel. Elsewhere in commodities trading, Brent oil for delivery in November fell 0.32% or 0.20 to hit $62.19 a barrel, while the December Gold Futures contract rose 0.10% or 1.45 to trade at $1513.75 a troy ounce.

USD/JPY was down 0.07% to 107.69, while EUR/JPY fell 0.06% to 117.83.

The US Dollar Index Futures was down 0.01% at 98.653.
description: Japan stocks higher at close of trade; Nikkei 225 up 0.13%
